attributes.action: SNP and Greens Parties to be represented in televised debates between party leaders previous to the 2015 elections
attributes.additional_details:
The UKIP leader will be allowed to attend the leader's debates previous to the 2015 election.

The SNP has 6 MPs and the Green Party has 1, as does UKIP. Sinn Fein and Plaid Cymru currently has triple the number of UKIP MPs. Why, therefore, have they been allowed to attend this debate?

We propose, that for the sake of proportionality, that the leaders of the Green Party and SNP be allowed to attend these debates.
